snippet: Tasmania, with its huge poppy crop, is the top producer of a crucial raw material in prescription drugs. But companies fear that they depend too much on that harvest.
abstract: Tasmania, with its huge opium poppy crop, is the top producer of a crucial raw material in prescription drugs, with sales of $12 billion annually; drug companies fear that they depend too much on that harvest, and GlaxoSmithKline and Johnson & Johnson are diversifying supply sources and altering plant's genome to produce stronger, more productive crop.
lead_paragraph: Tasmania, with its huge poppy crop, is the top producer of a crucial raw material in prescription drugs. But companies fear that they depend too much on that harvest.

headline.seo: Tasmania, Big Supplier to Drug Companies, Faces Changes
